Kuchipudi is a dance-drama performance with religious roots and often performed in a Krishna-oriented Vaishnavism tradition. It features costumed actors who perform a short preliminary dance, followed by pure dance and expressive storytelling using rhythmic hand gestures, accompanied by vocal and instrumental Carnatic music.
Kuchipudi dance has Carnatic music associated with it, and differences in costumes, structure, interpretation and creative innovations compared to other classical Hindu dance traditions.
